alert.note: Alert for Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:36PM EST until January 10 at 6:16PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST WEDNESDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern Connecticut, including the following county, Fairfield and southeast New York, including the following counties, Putnam, Rockland and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 936 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yonkers, Stamford, Danbury, New Rochelle, White Plains, Port Chester, Ossining, Peekskill, New Canaan, Tarrytown, Mount Kisco, Dobbs Ferry, Nyack, Tappan, Greenwich, Harrison, Ridgefield, Bethel, Wilton and Scarsdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
